rsbNotes.title: Ps 31:21
rsbNotes.text: 31:21 besieged city. This phrase is difficult to understand. The psalmist could be remembering a particular incident. It may be that the original reading was “in a difficult time,” a rendering that fits the context well. A copyist’s error in one letter would account for the difference of reading.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 31:23
rsbNotes.text: 31:23 his saints. The word is formed from the same Hebrew root (h.esed) as “steadfast love,” understood as God’s lovingkindness toward those in a covenant relationship with Him.
